full_text: Been doing things. Going to have some pretty automated stuff to show you all soon, but for now, some kinda neat stuff I found.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Disclaimer: None of these things I'm about to tell you are 100% accurate. Just *mostly* accurate. There are always exceptions.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: In the past 12 hrs, GG hashtag saw 1018 tweets/hr (776 of which were RTs). Min: 662 (473) Max: 1519 (1233). majority of non-RT came from bot
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Tweets which saw the most RTs tend to be questionable, abusive, and almost always aimed at @spacekatgal, @thequinnspiracy, @femfreq, and me.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: In the past 12h, @spacekatgal is seeing the most targeted abuse, with 194 (36 OC/158 RT) GG hashtaged tweets mentioning her. Congrats!
label: Non-offensive

full_text: This is followed not-so-closely by @femfreq, with 80 (44 OC/36 RT) GG hashtagged tweets mentioning her. Better luck next time.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: When we look at all mentions of a username, including RTs, @spacekatgal has received 1611 in the past 12h. @femfreq has received 911.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Can't wait until I get more data on this. But it looks like @spacekatgal should probably avoid her mentions at 8-10AM PDT Sundays. ;)

full_text: Verified accts for all is an OK idea, but too much administrative overhead. There are better ways, which I've talked about in the past.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: verified accounts have features that other accounts do not. not sure what kind of overhead increasing that # would have.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: however, twitter clients and web are supposed to have the same tools/exp. that's why devpolicy doesn't really encourage 3rd party clients.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: the ability to lock a unique phone # to your account already exists. eng/infra is already there. expose if a # has been added via metadata.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: add a filter to toggle showing phone-verified accts in clients (requires devpolicy update, natch).
label: Non-offensive

full_text: does have some drawbacks. but a 2nd toggle saying 'show me accts older than N days' is easy. metadata already exists. client/policy update.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: phone # idea isn't perfect (it's easy enough to grab a phone # from GV), but it's an extra step - good deterrent for majority of abuse.

full_text: in short, there needs to be a verified that isn't Verified. requiring govt ids will cause probs. unique phone less problematic, not perfect.

full_text:
DoS/DDoS doesn't refer to a technique or method of transport.

It's largely defined by intention + end result.

This is not rocket surgery.

label: Non-offensive

full_text: It was difficult. I questioned if it was a good idea until someone in the crowd came forward for a hug & started crying. Then I was crying.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Then q&a for both of us keynote speakers got hijacked to show harassment happening live. Both of us talked about diff aspects of harassment.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Talked about the need for support, mentors. People that understand because they've been through it all, too.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: I was blown away. I couldn't even think of a more impactful way of getting across the point that this is a problem we need to talk about.

full_text: At this moment in time, I am unaware of any effort he has made into this space. I'm tied in w/many orgs. His name has never once come up.

full_text: He's been offered contact info from those he's speaking with should he care to contribute. He's utilized none of this. I am unimpressed.

full_text: If you're interested in working on solutions, we'd love to have your help. However, I can spot a flail for media attention from a mile away.

full_text: Listening to @twoscooters talk about how harassment is important. And how we are going to help you through it.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: "I'm bringing it up for one reason. GamerGate has brought harassment into the limelight, but rest assured, it's always there."
label: Non-offensive

full_text: This is a problem that affects everyone, but we have seen far more harassment targeting women.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: It is fitting that we are now seeing these strong women speaking out and trying to fix problems that others are uncertain of how to tackle.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Oh gosh she mentioned me and #ggautoblocker in her talk and now I am blushing and trying not to sniffle.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: In this ongoing tragedy, we found our voices & each other. We have learned to work together, and to support & encourage these amazing women.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: I can't even find the words to describe how much I value the work of all the people I've met during this time. How much I love all of them.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: We talk about GamerGate a lot. But the truth is, GamerGate isn't the real battle. It's a symptom of a larger problem.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Online harassment is something most people have faced at some point, regardless of their views on ethics in games journalism.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: It's a really tough problem, because it's a BIG problem. It is far reaching. It has many different forms.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: The scope of the problem can discourage people from trying to fight it. Often this leads to thinking, "what can I do? I'm just one person."
label: Non-offensive

full_text: You aren't just one person. There are many of us, and we all have voices. But more than that, we have resources, experience, and passion.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: You aren't alone in this. You're never alone in this.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: We have seen so many fantastic things happen out of this tragedy. First, we have @femfreq. Amazing advocacy. A voice that is far reaching.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: We have @crashoverridenw, an invaluable resource that provides emotional support for targets of harassment.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Both of these organizations have been created to address different aspects of very real problems that affect all of us.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: It's almost time. :)
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Today, I am happy to announce the Online Abuse Prevention Initiative, created with @TheQuinnspiracy, @alexlifschitz, & @SheriRubin.

full_text: OAPI will focus on creating technical solutions for online abuse. http://t.co/Gh10Nt5rEB
label: Non-offensive

full_text: OAPI is already working with several tech companies to develop & engineer solutions for social problems. We are tech advocates for the user.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: OAPI will be partnering with @crashoverridenw to provide them with the tools they need.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: We're creating tools and resources for individuals. We're working directly with companies on developer policies to make this a reality.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: We know what online abuse looks like. We've been studying it, and we will create reports and publish our findings.

Whiny manbabies.

Public speaking.
Perl.
Standing up for those that are afraid.
FEELS.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Yeah, I get threats. And it means I have to be cautious. But really, I'm crazy enough to think I'm unbreakable, which is why this works.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: I could get hurt. Someone could come after me. Hell, people have shown up at my office before. I've been doxxed. I've been threatened.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: So I don't think about it. Instead, I use it as fuel. I'd rather try to fix this so others don't have to go through this, too.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: That's why we have @join_oapi. Because going on the internet without fearing for your life should be a basic human right.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Combating online harassment doesn't mean jerks won't exist. Everyone is a jerk, sometimes. But you shouldn't ever be afraid.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: Online harassment takes many forms. Some is actionable, by the service provider (ToS) or law enforcement.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: We seek to help clarify those policies and gain better enforcement, as well as provide users with the power to filter what they experience.
label: Non-offensive

full_text: @beardyblue never feel bad about that. it's pretty intense if you're not prepared for it.

full_text: There's no one-size-fits-all answer for online harassment. But we're in this for the long haul. We've got ideas. We will help.
label: Non-offensive
